- Use a second Wii Remote™ to drop-in and assist when needed.
- Monitor your child's gameplay with the Parents Page tracking.
- Game difficulty adapts to your child's level.

Source: The Game Website.

126851.name: Let's Dance
126851.description:
Let's Dance with Mel B is a revolutionary party game that will allow you to see yourself on the TV screen and dance "on stage" together with other professional dancers, thanks to advanced body tracking technology. Enjoy and practice your dancing skills listening to the notes of 28 famous songs from the modern Lady Gaga, Pussycat Dolls, Rihanna, Fergie, Mika, David Guetta to the classic Gloria Gaynor, Sarah Vaughn, Rose Royce and Culture Club. With fascinating dancing styles and music genres "Let's Dance with Mel B" guarantees the glossy party atmosphere directly at home.

Source: The Publisher Website.

126852.name: Zaga-33
126852.description:
User Summary

Zaga-33 is a puzzle roguelike in which the player attempts to navigate 28 randomly generated levels with increasingly difficult sets of monsters each of which acts in a distinctive pattern. Apart from careful choice of moves, the player is also able to collect various items, the appearance of which are randomised for each new game.

126854.name: Hamsterz Life
126854.description:
Box Description:

Because there's no such thing as too much cute!

-Play mini-games and buy cute toys for your favorite hamster.

-Raise your hamster well and he'll have plenty of energy to build a huge "ham-country," with a bakery, school, playground, and more!

-Choose an adorable hamster from 5 different breeds, care for him, and train him.

126855.name: Pikmin RPG (Beta Versions)
126855.description:
from the designer's blog on 1KM1KT

Explore with the help of pikmin, small plant creatures. You should be familiar with the Pikmin series of videogames or you won’t understand this game.

This is my first shot at writing a full rpg.

I do not own Pikmin or any of it’s trademarks.
Pikmin and all of it’s trademarks are property of nintendo.

The Planet of the Pikmin…

Ever since Captain Olimar discovered this plant-filled planet, explorers from Hocotate have come by the dozens in search of treasure, creatures, and knowledge. Some suceed; Others are killed by the indigenous wildlife. All of them, however, are aided by the Pikmin, the small plant creatures that first helped Captain Olimar. Since Olimar left the planet for the second time, several new species of Pikmin have been discovered. Red, Blue, Yellow, Purple, White, Green, Orange, and the elusive Bulbmin will all help you on your adventure. So strap yourself into your ship, cross your fingers, and blast off!

Pikmin Rpg is a role playing game based off of the popular Pikmin videogame series.

To play this game you need:

At least one 1d4, 1d6, 1d8, 1d10, 1d12, 1d20.

Paper

Pencil

Imagination! =)

126856.name: Ultimate I Spy
126856.description:
Play paddleball, throw darts , juggle, and more to solve immersive 3-D riddles. Uncover a mysterious machine, unlock a heart-stopping game and compete for bragging rights with 10 multiplayer games in an I SPY experience that will have you up and moving!

Source: The Game Website.

126857.name: I Spy: Spooky Mansion (Wii)
126857.description:
Discover a thrilling I SPY adventure hidden in a mysterious old house! A clever skeleton traps you inside his spooky mansion with a challenge to find his secret way out. Explore each room of the house in first-person perspective to reveal over 30 I SPY riddles. Solve I SPY riddles, earn clues and play brain-teasing games to uncover the mansion’s secret escape

Source: The Game Website.

126858.name: Dead Ringer
126858.description:
User Summary

Dead Ringer is a game designed by Lance Mason and programmed by Darrell Etherington.

The player is placed in a 'Skimmer' driving along a road strewn with obstacles. The skimmer can turn left or right to avoid obstacles. Speed can be varied with up or down on the joystick and obstacles can also be blasted out of the way with the fire button, but shots are limited.

The object is to "Stay alive until time runs out". A timer counts down on the right hand side of the screen. To the far right is your skimmer's health, which starts at 99 and reduces by varying amounts when you hit an enemy. You have a total of three skimmers.

The title music is a chiptunes version of "Dead Ringer for Love" by Meatloaf.

126859.name: Combat Mission: Fortress Italy

videogameexpansion.140754: Combat Mission: Fortress Italy – Gustav Line

videogamehonor.23085: 2012 Charles S. Roberts Best 20th Century Era - Modern Computer Wargame Nominee

126859.description:
Fortress Italy is a new "family" of Combat Mission games covering the Allied struggle to knock Italy out of the Second World War. This initial release deals explicitly with the battle for Sicily and sets the groundwork for future additions to simulate the hard fighting in the rugged terrain of "Europe's underbelly" up until the war's end in 1945.

Combat Mission: Fortress Italy does NOT require any of the previous Combat Mission titles to play. Both PC and Mac versions are available!

Steve Grammont from Battlefront.com comments, "We always wanted to return to the Mediterranean Theater, though figured it would be several years before we got to it. Simply put, the stars aligned last summer and work started in September. Now it is in final beta testing and it's time to tell you what to expect from it."

Source: The Developer Website.

126860.name: Blind Peg
126860.description:
Up to four players each have a wooden board with 10 holes for pegs. They blindly draw colored pegs out of the can which is also used to store the game. If the peg is their color, them they get to score it, otherwise the peg is discarded and it is the next players turn. Two specially colored pegs. A silver peg forces a player to remove one of his pegs and return it to the can. A gold peg gives the player three more draws in the same turn.

The game was packaged in a round can about 3.5 inches in diameter and 4.75 inches tall.

126861.name: Edgewise
126861.description:
Edgewise is a speed matching tile game where you race to play your 12 player chips first by matching the edges to the starter chip of each round or any player chips already played. There are twelve rounds that change with each starter chip. A point is scored for each chip played along with bonus points. The most points at the end of all the rounds wins the game. The game can be customized to however many rounds you want to play. If your time is limited, you can play 2-3 different rounds in under 20 minutes. You can also have multiple games going at the same time since Edgewise has 12 starter chips that determine each round.

Contents: 84 hexagon-shaped game pieces
Game Pieces: 72 Player Tiles (12-Black, 12-Turquoise, 12-Pink, 12-Green, 12-Orange, 12-Purple), 12 Starter Tiles (1-"Basic" round, 1-"Follow the Leader" round, 1-"Teams" round, 1-"Longest Chain" round, 1-"No Reds" round, 1-"Opposites Attract" round, 1-"Stack 'Em" round, 1-"Capture" round, 1-"Dead End" round, 1-"Freeze Tag" round, 1-"Rotate" round, 1-"Share the Love" round)

126862.name: The Speed-Boat Race
126862.description: A simple roll and move game. Players start in Southampton and then follow the track around the British Isles, ending up back at Southampton. Certain spaces give help or hindrance along the way. First to get back there, wins.

126863.name: Triple Play 98
126863.description:
Box Description:

-Compete as Rookie, Pro, or All-Star

-Signature Pitching and Batting styles

-Over 5,000 frames of animation

-New Real-Time 3-D Technology

-New First Ever 2-man Booth: Play-by-Play and Color Commentary

-New TV-Style Presentation: Over 20 Camera Views

-New Smarter Players

-MLB and MLBPA License

-6 Ways To Play: Exhibition, Season, Series. Home Run Derby, All-Star, and Practice Modes

-Improved AI & Strategy

-New Deeper Stats: Over 50 Stats Tracked

-New Expansion Teams & Drafts

-New Interleague Play

-1997 Team Rosters with 1996 Stats

-Arcade and Simulation Gameplay. Plus 3 Difficulty Levels

-All 30 MLB Stadiums

-Trade and create Players

126864.name: Tactical Commander: World War II Skirmish Rules
126864.description:
These wargame rules are for World War II 1/76th scale battles and skirmishes. They have been formulated over half a dozen years and countless battlefields. They provide for almost every aspect of late World War II battles, with sections on air and naval support, paratroop, glider and beach landings, with a good blend of detail, realism, and playability.

64 pages

126865.name: Modern Equipment Handbook
126865.description: This 92 page handbook provides the most comprehensive coverage of all armoured vehicles, artillery, helicoptes and missiles which are in service or have been in service since the 1950s. The data is laid out for Tabeltop Games Challenger II rules and WRG's Armoured Warfare 1950 to 1985, but is also detailed enough to be of interest to other armoured vehicle enthusiasts.

126866.name: Unit Organizations of World War II
126866.description:
The purpose of this book is to present a Table of Organization & Equipment (TO&E) for several basic ground combat units found in most armies that directly participated in World War II

Each TO&E Chart identifies division to platoon sized units that can be easily duplicated in any scale.

Each of the units can be duplicated on a 1-on-1 ratio where an actual 42 man platoon is represented by 42 scale men with appropriate equipment and weapons

126867.name: The Fifth Annual Neo-Anarchists Guide to Everything Else

rpgissue.14487: The Annual Neo-Anarchists Guide to Everything Else

126867.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Fifth Annual Neo-Anarchists Guide to Everything Else, a Shadowrun fanzine.

This issue marks the dawn of a new age, the resurrection of the NAGEE. After several months of withdraws from waiting for NAGEE 5 to hit the nets, I finally broke down and e-mailed Jerry. After Jerry told me he was too busy to continue the NAGEE, his response to me was, “You want to do it?” Well, at first I thought, “No way,” and more time went by. Finally I broke down and said I’d give it a try.

Well, here it is. If all goes well, and my family is still talking to me by the time I get done with it, I will go for NAGEE 6. Honestly folks, I really do plan to do NAGEE 6, and even 7 and 8. I’ve even got plans for a big summer supplement for those really loooooonnnnnngggggg articles you’ve sent in.
So, sit back and enjoy my first crack at taking over for Jerry. And if it turns out I did a really drekky job, just go frag yourselves!

126868.name: The Second Annual Neo-Anarchists Guide to Everything Else

rpgissue.14487: The Annual Neo-Anarchists Guide to Everything Else

126868.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Second Annual Neo-Anarchists Guide to Everything Else. This is a semi-regular electronically-distributed magazine devoted to FASA's Shadowrun® role-playing game. In the NAGEE, we're covering everything else.

We are now accepting ads. Prices must be listed in Nuyen, and you must give an LTG number. If you're worried about deckers, you're in the wrong place, chummer. Advertising space is free, but we reserve the right to hold our nose and drop your copy into the round file. So, your team need a little exposure? Your band playing a hot date? Need to sell some specially acquired information? Hey, just send us the ad and we'll stick it in here.

Or, not. But what've you got to lose?

126871.name: Two-Fisted Tales Card Deck
126871.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This specially-produced deck contains 54 cards that display their correct usage while playing Two-Fisted Tales. Since they also display values and suits, they can double as regular playing cards. Includes two reference cards.

126872.name: Toby
126872.description:
Objective: Be the first turning back to your starting point & collecting all 3 wooden chips, placed at 3 different corners.

- Place your meeple onto appropriate (coloured) corner of the board & 3 of your chips into all other corners.
- Roll the die by turns: move according the number into direction free of choice; ending on an arrow move into that direction next turn; ending on an image you are going to be teleported to the appropriate second image; passing a corner collect your wooden chip.

remarks:
very cute wooden meeples - produced in the Erz Mountains; one of the reasons why this game is rather difficult to get

126873.name: Jewel Duel
126873.description:
There can be only one. One court jeweler, that is. And of course this can only be you, if nothing fishy's going on.
But isn't it always? It is right here and right now in the kingdom of Gemonaria. Here the best jeweler has to prove herself / himself by cleverly obtaining gold and jewels from the gemstone market and creating more beautiful jewelry than her / his opponents in a contest.
Only this way can she / he impress her / his king / queen (delete as applicable) and become court jeweler.

Jewel Duel is a largely abstract family level strategy game by Thomas Staudt for 1 - 4 players that compete for resources (wooden cubes) using a novel chip mechanic in order to create jewelry (buy cards) and accumulate the most victory points.

This game is available as a free print & play download.

126874.name: 5 x 5 War
126874.description:
This two player print and play game is actually inspired from a variant of Fire from the Sky. This game depicts the battle between two small armies of 9 soldiers each in a board of 25 grids(5 rows and 5 columns.) Three dice are also used. Each player takes the control of an army.

All the soldier tokens are placed in the board, one token per square. The soldiers are imagined to have both melee weapons(sword or mace) and ranged weapons. The players can throw up to three dice per turn to determine an action to be taken on the war field (board). The number of dice thrown are determined by the number of soldiers he has left on the field. Nine to seven soldiers means he can throw three dice. Six to four means he can throw 2 dice and three to one soldiers means he can throw just one die.

Out of the dice he can choose any one as a row number and the other as column number. (means more the number of soldiers he has more choices at his disposal). If the grid on the field selected using this row and column has an enemy soldier, the enemy soldier is removed. If it has the player's own soldier, he can move one square and can capture an enemy soldier if there's one in that square.

If the user threw six, he can use it to destroy an entire row(chose a six and a row number ), or an entire column (chose a six and column number) or a combination of both (when he chose a double six for row and column), killing enemy soldiers and maybe his own soldiers as collateral damage.

126875.name: I Spy Game Pack
126875.description:
User Summary

I Spy Game Pack is a compilation of I Spy: Spooky Mansion and Ultimate I Spy.

126876.name: The Seventh Neo-Anarchists Guide to Everything Else

rpgissue.14487: The Annual Neo-Anarchists Guide to Everything Else

rpgissuearticle.160911: Fetishes, Foci, and the Astral Plane

126876.description:
From the front cover:

In this issue:
A   Shadowrun E-zine
• Pocket Secretaries
• Silent Weapons
• Native American Tribes
• Street Gangs
• NAGEE 1 & 2 Updates
…and plenty more!

126877.name: The Eighth Annual Neo-Anarchists Guide to Everything Else

rpgissue.14487: The Annual Neo-Anarchists Guide to Everything Else

126877.description:
From the front cover:

A Shadowrun E-zine

In this issue:
Free Spirits
The Ice Box
Short stories
Data Theft: A complete
adventure
NAGEE 3 Updates

126878.name: Luftibus auf Reisen
126878.description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 90)
simple 'Roll and Move' game - use only one die between 1-14 and above 72, otherwise 2 dice
remarks:
very cute drawings
very nice coloured pewter figures
should had been published between 1910-15

126879.description:
One of Club Penguin's first card games to play with your friends in real life. In this game you use Disney's Club Penguin characters and locations to find matches.

6 island cards are placed on the play surface face up and one see through penguin card is placed face up on each island. Each player takes a turn to flip a character card (which shows a penguin on an island) from their draw pile and put it on a common pile. All players then try to find matches with the penguins on the island cards. The first person to spot the match calls it out and collects the common pile (and add the cards to the bottom of their draw pile) and the island/see through penguin cards are removed from play.

Description from the box: "Are your flippers fast enough to catch the most Penguins! Lay down the unique see-thru Penguin character cards on the Background Island cards, then use your "fast flippers" to pick-up as many Club Penguin cards as possible!"
126879.name: Disney Club Penguin Card Game Fast Flippers!

126880.name: The Ninth Annual Neo-Anarchists Guide to Everything Else

rpgissue.14487: The Annual Neo-Anarchists Guide to Everything Else

126880.description:
From the front page:

Boston Metroplex 2061
Target: UCAS expansion
Vampiric Double-Take
Two visions on
vampire PCs

Regular Features:
The On-Line Grimoire
The Chipper
NAGEE 4 & 5 Updates
The Black Market
The Rolodex
More bytes than ever!*

126881.name: American Boys
126881.description: A Fox and Geese type game played on an irregular network of positions. The one red scout is trying to reach the bottom of the board and get back home. The six blue scouts are trying to block him so that he cannot move.

126882.name: Revenge of the Mutant Camels
126882.description:
User Summary

This is the second in Jeff Minter's "Mutant Camel" series which sees you controlling a large mutant camel with the ability to spit shots at hordes of incoming enemies. A second player can join in and play cooperatively as a goat.

In-Game Text

The game consists of forty two different attack waves. Two modes of play are available: Normal wave sequency, starting at wave 1 are proceeding to level 42, or random wave sequency, where your next wave is randomly drawn from any of the first 32.

126883.name: Return of the Mutant Camels
126883.description:
User Summary

The third in the Mutant Camel series.

From the back of the box (Amiga Edition):

Drive your very own 90 foot Mutated Camel in a quest for revenge in this all action death dealing shoot-em-up!

126891.name: Rubicon
126891.description:
User Summary

Rubicon is set on a Russian island which has been subject to a nuclear accident, causing the creatures inhabiting the island to be hideously mutated. The creatures have been given high intelligence along with increased aggression. And they have found a stockpile of mothballed soviet nuclear weapons...

You have been sent in to destroy the mutants!

The game is played over 5 levels and plays similarly to Turrican.

126892.name: Only War (Beta)
126892.description:
From publisher blurb:

Only War is a Warhammer 40,000 roleplaying game in which players take on the roles of soldiers in the galaxy-spanning armies of the Imperium, and the Only War beta test is your chance to stand on the front lines of its development! As part of the Only War beta test, you’ll provide valuable reconnaissance for the war effort, as you help us to craft the best possible final product.

The Only War beta is a complete, 256-page playable version of Only War; the only difference is that it omits certain art pieces and background “flavor” that will be present in the final version. This product has already undergone extensive development, playtesting, and refinement, and we have no doubt that it’s ready to provide hours of enjoyment. What’s more, Only War beta test participants have an opportunity to experience the game months before they otherwise would!

126893.name: Mean Streets Expanded
126893.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This PDF collection includes the Mean Streets core book, companion Enhancement Pack, and Casablanca add-on.

Explore the best and bleakest aspects of film noir, presenting a concept with which to portray detectives, femmes fatale, desperate district attorneys, grifters and con artists, government agents, and reporters during the Classic Age of 1940's film noir.

126894.name: Felix
126894.description:
User Summary

Felix is a game written by Paul Montwill and published by Hit Pak.

The game is set in a series of mazes. Within the maze are a number of orbs which need to be collected within a time limit. The maze is patrolled by a number of re-spawning enemies.

The user controls a hovering craft which can move and fire in eight directions (though your weapon has no effect on some enemies). The craft can hold only one orb at a time, so alternates between "Search" mode when you are looking for orbs and "Return" mode, where you must return to the Home position in the maze.

If you run into an enemy (or the walls of the maze), your power bar is reduced. If the bar is reduced to zero, then it's Game Over. However returning an orb home returns some of your power. If you run out of time, then it is also Game Over.

On completing a level you are awarded a life (you start with none). However additional restrictions are imposed. For example on the second level your ship cannot fire when returning with an orb.

126895.name: Omen
126895.description:
Omen is a game of strategy, luck, and magic!

Harness the power of the elements to cast spells that enhance your abilities and hinder your opponents in a race around the kingdom.

Become the most powerful sorcerer by creating elemental Gems, but be careful; draw an Omen card and your luck will flip on its head!

HOW TO PLAY:
In Omen, players embody 1 of 4 elements and strive to become the most powerful sorcerer. Each turn, players roll the dice and move across the board. If players land on an element space, they collect the corresponding Elemental card and place a Totem, which gives them ownership of that space. The more Totems a player has in play, the more chance they have of collecting Elemental Cards from opponents who land on their spaces, and the more cards they get passing their Castle (home base). These Elemental cards are in turn used to cast devious spells on opponents, or help the player in different ways. Elemental cards are also used to create Gems. The first player to collect 7 of each Elemental card they don't represent and use those to create 3 Gems is the winner.

"Omen is the brainchild of Benjamin Conner, an avid board-gamer who works in the Visual Effects Industry. Having never made a board game before, Benjamin sought out copies of all the most popular games and dissected each one to find out what made it tick, and more importantly what made it fun. Omen is the fantastical game that resulted out of those years of research. Simple and elegant yet full of strategy, Omen is sure to please the whole family and keep you yearning for more."

126896.name: Once Upon a Time
126896.description:
Once upon a time is a group of 4 fairytales with different play options on the Wii. The game is interactive and aimed at children 3+ who either cannot read and write up to those that can in the early stages. Interaction is the key to the title which has 3 Game modes being Listen to the Story, Tell you own Story, mini games designed for the young covering puzzles, wiggling on animation, grouping pairs and a memory game.

Features

- The four classic stories, Ugly Duckling, Red Riding Hood, Three little pigs, and Puss In Boots
- 54 interactive book pages and over 300 animated objects
- Enhances your reading experience with the ability to navigate through the storyline at your own pace with the Touch Screen
- Each interaction is rewarded with an animation, and a sound effect or a voiceover

Source: The Publisher Website.

126897.name: One Piece: Unlimited Adventure
126897.description:
One Piece: Unlimited Adventure (アンリミテッドアドベンチャー Wan Pīsu: Anrimiteddo Adobenchaa) is a video game for the Nintendo Wii based on the manga and anime series One Piece by Eiichiro Oda.

Story Mode

A basic adventure game with platforms, puzzles, and item collecting. To go farther in the game, the player must collect certain items for Franky and Usopp to make new tools in order to create new paths. Fishing and bug hunting are also a major side quests; certain bugs and fish have to be captured to break seals.

Vs. Mode

The player can choose from any of the over 40 characters that have appeared in the game (including basic enemies and final boss) in the battle mode. The player can play in Survival mode or fight against a computer or a friend in a basic battle.

Source: Wikipedia, "One Piece: Unlimited Adventure", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

126898.name: One Piece: Unlimited Cruise 1 – The Treasure Beneath the Waves
126898.description:
One Piece: Unlimited Cruise (ワンピース:アンリミテッドクルーズ Wan Pīsu: Anrimiteddo Kurūzu?) is a video game for the Nintendo's Wii console based on the popular manga and anime One Piece.

There are five different islands in Episode 1; A winter island, a desert island with a seashell, an island with a giant tree and waterfalls under it, and a island that is essentially a giant cave. The final island is where the player fights the final boss, Doom Guardian. The Thousand Sunny can be explored, showing many of the rooms inside of it. In the Tankōbon version of One Piece manga, Oda drew a detailed interior design for Thousand Sunny including each piece of furniture and passage ways. From the current preview it seems Unlimited Cruise kept Oda's design down to exact detail down to the patterns on the walls and furniture. In Episode 2, there are five locations(not including Thousand Sunny) : a desert location that resembles Alabasta, and a dark, murky, ruinous place that looks like Thriller Bark. The Thousand Sunny is a stage in which the players can interact various rooms with, however, it is not an island. There is also an Island that looks similar to the "Seaside Zone" of Unlimited Adventure, but lightly edited, and could possibly be based on the island in the Ocean's Dream arc where the Straw Hats had their memories stolen. The fourth location is a floating island. This island could also be based on Skypeia as the island is supported by a large beanstalk which bears a striking resemblance to Giant Jack. The final island where the final boss Doom Guardian is held also looks nearly identical to how it looked in Episode 1.

Source: Wikipedia, "One Piece: Unlimited Cruise", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

126899.name: One Piece: Unlimited Cruise 2 – Awakening of a Hero
126899.description:
One Piece: Unlimited Cruise (ワンピース:アンリミテッドクルーズ Wan Pīsu: Anrimiteddo Kurūzu?) is a video game for the Nintendo's Wii console based on the popular manga and anime One Piece.

There are five different islands in Episode 1; A winter island, a desert island with a seashell, an island with a giant tree and waterfalls under it, and a island that is essentially a giant cave. The final island is where the player fights the final boss, Doom Guardian. The Thousand Sunny can be explored, showing many of the rooms inside of it. In the Tankōbon version of One Piece manga, Oda drew a detailed interior design for Thousand Sunny including each piece of furniture and passage ways. From the current preview it seems Unlimited Cruise kept Oda's design down to exact detail down to the patterns on the walls and furniture. In Episode 2, there are five locations(not including Thousand Sunny) : a desert location that resembles Alabasta, and a dark, murky, ruinous place that looks like Thriller Bark. The Thousand Sunny is a stage in which the players can interact various rooms with, however, it is not an island. There is also an Island that looks similar to the "Seaside Zone" of Unlimited Adventure, but lightly edited, and could possibly be based on the island in the Ocean's Dream arc where the Straw Hats had their memories stolen. The fourth location is a floating island. This island could also be based on Skypeia as the island is supported by a large beanstalk which bears a striking resemblance to Giant Jack. The final island where the final boss Doom Guardian is held also looks nearly identical to how it looked in Episode 1.

Source: Wikipedia, "One Piece: Unlimited Cruise", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

126900.name: WWII Battlezones
126900.description:
Scenarios for WWII 1/300th scale wargames.

Includes both historical and fictional battles.

All scenarios are laid out in common format:
1. Background
2. Game Size
3. Conditions
4. Force Lists
5. Reinforcements
6. Notes

Also, each scenario has a map included

126902.name: Probsub
126902.description: Probsub is a set of rules which simulates modern combat betwen nuclear submarines, and also includes anti-submarine aircraft and helicopters. All aspects of anti-submarine warfare are covered except the use of surface vessels.

126903.description:
Corps Commander OMG (Operational Manoeuvre Group) is miniature gaming rules for 1/285 and 1/300 micro armor cold war era divisional scale operations. Ground scale is 10cm = 1km. A metric tape measure and several 6-sided and 10-sided dice are required.

100 page paperback book with a folded two sided quick reference card. There are 44 pages of rules followed by 20 pages of army organisations which include the United States, Belgium, UK, Canadian, Danish, Dutch, French, German, and Warsaw Pact. The final section has equipment data including helicopters, missiles and aircraft.
126903.name: Corps Commander: OMG

126904.name: By Air & Sea
126904.description:
This book is a supplement to Corps Commander OMG and that book is required to be used in conjuction with this one.

Extensive rules are included for all airborne operations and in an abstract way amphibious assaults. The army lists include all of the remainder of NATO countries, even Luxembourg! Together with WARPAC air naval assault units. Operations on NATOs Norther and Southern Flanks can now be simulated including overseas reinforcements and special forces.

126905.name: The Ebb and Flow of Battle: Module 3 – The Peninsular Campaign
126905.description:
Grand tactical warfare rules focusing on 1809-1811 featuring the defense of Portugal and the securing of a base for operation with the capture of the fortress of Cuidad Rodrigo and Badajoz.

Dice are not used with these rules

126906.name: Tricorne
126906.description:
Tricorne is a set of rules for warfare in the 18th century. They cover the period of transition from the pike and shot armed regiments to the mass armies of the Revolutionary Wars.

Ground Scale:
20/25mm miniatures - 1 inch = 10 yards
15/18mm miniatures - 1 cm = 10 yards

126907.name: Bonaparte
126907.description:
Bonaparte is a set of wargame rules which recreate warfare in the era between the French Revolution and Napoleon's final defeat at Waterloo

Ground Scale:
20/25mm - 1" = 10 yards
10/12/15mm - 1cm = 10 yards
6mm - 1cm = 20 yards

Figure Scale
1 figure = 50 real men
1 gun model = up to 6 pieces

126908.name: Deal or no Deal: Elektronische Versie
126908.description:
Analogous to the TV program you can now play with family and friends about the big money.
Everyone chooses one of the suitcases from the electronic board and each round a certain number of cases opened, then the bank makes an offer based on the remaining sum, the player can accept or reject, he refuses to be in the next round, open suitcase. Who will score the higher amount, whether by accepting the bank offer or the amount in the last remaining case is the winner.

126909.name: Alles verdreht
126909.description:
Objective: be the first covering all 10 numbers of your playing segment

acting by turns -
each player gets 10 (coloured) chips
player with red starts turning the spinner
- if a number within his own (coloured) segment is shown by the arrow => cover that number with a chip
- if a number within another coloured segment is shown by the arrow => correspondent player puts a chip on this number
- if an already covered number is shown by the arrow => correspondent player puts a chip on the following number (+1)
- if a 'zero' is shown => each player has to remove 1 chip

126911.name: Ballistrikks
126911.description:
This game simulates players trying to hit a target at the far end of a playing field using stones or similar projectiles. The target is either suspended in the air or on the ground, which will be agreed upon by the players. A graph paper or grid paper (10x10 or 20x20) represents the playing field. The movement of the projectiles per turn is determined by a standard die roll. Each player has four projectiles to throw. If the projectile hits the target or misses it, it is discarded from the game.

Each move starts with a dice roll. The player moves his projectile according to the dice roll. For each dice roll, the user can choose to move a projectile which is already airborne or introduce a new projectile into the playing field. For the initial moves the projectile has to travel towards the sky (top of the graph paper) in a diagonal manner (towards top right). After the projectile is airborne, the player can choose whether the projectile has to fall down in this turn. If he chooses so, then the projectile will have to move horizontally for this turn and the next turn onwards the projectile moves towards bottom right(ground) diagonally. The projectile always move to the right and cannot go back. (Should obey laws of gravity and projectile motion). The target is always placed at the second half of the paper, towards the right edge.

If the projectile hits the target the player is awarded 5 points. If the projectile hits another players projectile (lands in the same square) in the second half (right half) of the graph sheet, then 1 point is awarded and the opponent projectile is removed. The player can hit another player's projectile only in the second half of the field.Game continues till all projectiles are removed from the graph paper. The player with most points wins.

126912.description:
In Lady Alice – a game of intrigue, flair, bluffing, and mischief – the players are the Baker Street Kids, children under the tutelage of Sherlock Holmes who must deduce the culprit behind the kidnapping of Henry Morton Stanley as well as the time and place the kidnapping occurred and which object was stolen at the same time.

Holmes gives each player the solution to one of these categories at the start of the game, and players must keep such information secret. On a turn, the active player voices his suspicions in the form of a sentence – "I suspect ....... of having been seen at ....... at around ....... hundred in possession of ......." – filling in the blanks with one of the eight possibilities in each category. All players then secretly note whether or not they hold the evidence card for one of the four things named by placing a verdict card inside a folder. The active player shuffles these folders to disguise who answered in which ways, then reveals them. If all four items guessed were false, then you cover those four guesses on the game board with Holmes' business cards; otherwise players mentally note how many of the items were correct and try to decipher which ones those might be.

Players then participate in a deduction round in which each player can:


Place a deduction token on a clue.
Say "I pass".
Attempt an accusation.


If all players pass successively, the round ends and the next player in clockwise order then voices a suspicion. Otherwise a player can pass, then place a deduction token or attempt an accusation later in the same round.

Each player has nine deduction tokens in his color, three each of 0, 1 and 2. To place a token, you place it face-down on the clue of your choice to the right of any tokens already present; if any of those tokens are face-down, you reveal those tokens. At most four tokens can be placed on a clue.

To attempt an accusation, you say, "I accuse (suspect) of having been been seen at (place) at around (time) in possession of (object)", then all players submit their verdict cards the same way they normally do. If all of them are positive, you've solved the case – but not necessarily won the game. All tokens on incorrect clues and all tokens belonging to players who made a false accusation are removed, then players tally the numbers on their tokens, scoring bonus points if they have a token on each piece of evidence, or if they made a correct suspicion or accusation. The player with the most points wins.

With three or five players, you decrease (increase) the number of evidence cards handed out at the start of the game and the number of tokens that can be placed on a clue.
126912.name: Lady Alice

126913.description:
The game consists of thirty-two cards, representing eight cats and twenty-four mice and the cards are lay out on the table in 8x4 grid face-down.

In his turn, the active player may turn any card face-up.
If it's a mouse he may continue his turn turning another card or decide to stop and take all visible mice in front of him.
If it's a cat, his turn is over and he must turn all cards face-down again.

When all mice were found, the player who has the most mice wins the game.

From Noris edition:

Katz und Maus - Wer findet die meisten Mäuse
translated: Cat and mouse - who finds the most mice

From the box back that also contains the games rules:

The game consits of 32 cards depicting cats and mice. 24 cards are with mice, 8 cards with cats. They are laid out face down in a 4 by 8 grid after a good shuffle. A player turns over cards on his turn. When the revealed card is a mouse its good and he can continue turning over cards. He can secure his winnings and keep the mice or continue. When a cat is revealed the players turn is immediately over, the face up cards are turned face down again, the next players turn begins. Whoever has the most mice when all mice are revealed is the winner.

A simple push your luck game for children.
126913.name: Le Chat et la Souris

126914.name: Loviatar (Issue 1 -  Aug 2011)

rpgissuearticle.81267: At the Corner of River Street and Craft Way

126914.description:
From the front cover:

a zine about tabletop role-playing games

126915.name: Loviatar (Issue 2 -  Sep 2011)
126915.description:
From the front cover:

a zine about tabletop role-playing games

126916.name: Loviatar (Issue 3 - Oct 2011)
126916.description:
From the front cover:

a zine about tabletop role-playing games

126917.name: Loviatar (Issue 4 - Nov 2011)
126917.description:
From the front cover:

a zine about tabletop role-playing games

126918.name: Loviatar (Issue 5 -  Dec 2011)
126918.description:
From the front cover:

a zine about tabletop role-playing games

126919.name: Loviatar (Issue 6 - Jan 2012)
126919.description:
From the front cover:

a zine about tabletop role-playing games

126920.description:
Need a little help conquering the world?

How about enlisting the aid of Che Guevara, Karl Marx, Martin Luther, Joan of Arc, Gandhi, Oliver Cromwell or two dozen others?

The Revolutionaries expansion adds 30 new cards to World Conquerors.
126920.name: World Conquerors: Revolutionaries

126921.description:
A Down in Flames Campaign - Operation Leader Campaign provides for both solitaire and two players. The campaign request both Rise of the Luftwaffe and Zero to play.

Operation Leader was the code name for an attack undertaken by aircraft from the carrier USS Ranger on 4 October 1943 on German shipping along the coast of Norway in the Bodø area. The escorting force included the battleships HMS Duke of York and Anson, the cruisers USS Tuscaloosa and HMS Belfast, and 12 American and British destroyers including the USS Corry.

The task force reached launch position off the Vestfjorden before dawn on 4 October completely undetected. At 06:18, USS Ranger launched 20 SBD Dauntless dive bombers and an escort of eight F4F Wildcat fighters. One division of dive bombers attacked the 8,000 long tons (8,100 t) freighter LaPlata, while the rest continued north to attack a German ship convoy. The bombers severely damaged a 10,000 long tons (10,000 t) tanker and a smaller troop transport. They also sank two of four small German merchant ships in the Bodø roadstead.

A second attack group from Ranger—consisting of 10 TBF Avenger torpedo bombers and six Wildcats—destroyed a German freighter and a small coastal ship, and bombed a troop-laden transport. Three of the aircraft were lost to anti-aircraft fire. On the afternoon of 4 October, Ranger was located by three Luftwaffe aircraft; her combat air patrol shot down two of the enemy planes and chased away the third.
126921.name: Down in Flames: Operation Leader 1943

126922.name: Little Things
126922.description:
All the family can enjoy Little Things®, the innovative Hidden Object game for iPad®. Search colorful collages built from thousands of little things. Little Things features randomized lists so that you get a different game each time you play. Find over 7000 cleverly hidden objects, collect 99 jigsaw puzzles and 10 challenging badges.


Fun for the whole family.
Incredible artwork.
Hours of gameplay.
Badges to collect.
Thousands of little things.


Source: The Game Website.

126923.name: Grinder
126923.description:
User Summary

Grinder is a stylish but gruelingly difficult science-fiction platformer for the iOS. You control two characters, one on each side of the screen. You must guide the character on the left UP, past deadly obstacles and enemies. You must guide the character on the right ACROSS, over bottomless pits and other hazards. And you must do both things simultaneously.

Grinder features stylish black-and-white art and a custom soundtrack. But its most distinguishing feature is the near impossibility of surviving more than a few minutes.

126925.name: Rough Water
126925.description: Snow on the ground? No problem you can still play golf using a real score card with the game Rough Water. Swings are dealt from a card deck and you score for the hole is recorded just like on a real golf course.

126926.name: Croisémo
126926.description:
Crossword board game for two!
Game box contains a blank crossword grid, two packets of letters one for each player, some black squares and two books of identical definitions.

In his turn player can form one word from the book placing the missing letters to the crossword board.

At the end of the game, the winner is the one with the most letters in its color on the game board.

rpg.1297: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

126927.name: Advent of Darkness
126927.description:
Fron the front cover:

The high mage has revealed the discovery of a portal opening from an evil plane. The player characters must follow his instructions to recover a pair of magical artifacts that can reverse the opening of the portal.

An adventure module for 6 characters of levels 10-12.

126928.name: La Course du Vendée Globe
126928.description:
Build a ship and race around antarctic answering the Trivia questions about sailing.
Rolling different numbers and answering questions correctly players first earns ship parts and then roll and move around antarctic.

126929.name: A Leg of Hope
126929.description:
From the Introduction:

A Shadowrun Virtual Seattle Adventure

Welcome to A Leg of Hope, a Virtual Seattle adventure. This is the final installment in the "trilogy" of adventures centering around the Siracusa family. Each of the adventures can be run without the other two, but the experience wil be richer if it takes place within the larger context.
One final note - this adventure consists of THREE seperate runs, the last of which will probably be combat intensive. Keep them moving. Otherwise they will agonize over the minute details of the first or second run, and they won't finish in the time allotted. Since most time will be eaten up in planning, NPC's can be used to help them overcome stumbling blocks.

126930.name: Codename: Kids Next Door – Operation V.I.D.E.O.G.A.M.E.
126930.description:
Box Description:

Play as all five Kids Next Door operatives!

Get ready for an epic showdown! Father masterminds and Arctic prison break to free some of the most notorious and nasty villians the kids have ever battled!

-Battle favorite show villians including Stickybeard, Knightbrace, the Toiletnator and more

-Complete your missions through 14 action-packed levels

-Collect and assemble cool weapons from the TV show

-Gather powuh ups for operative power boosts

126931.name: MIMIC
126931.description:
Mimic (Memory Interfaced Micro Integrated Computer) is an electronic game similar to Simon. Colored LEDs light up in an ever increasing pattern, and the object is to "mimic" what has been shown each turn (and heard with beeps for each of the four colored buttons).
There are 3 play modes (1, 2, 3 -- not sure what these do) and 4 levels of difficulty (novice, amateur, junior, and pro) that can be set with two switches.

126932.name: Mickey Mouse Electric Treasure Hunt Game
126932.description:
The game is made by Tudor, the company who brought you the vibrating Electric Football game. Teamed up with Disney, this much simpler (and as a result, more fun for kids) game uses that same clever technology. Happily, all you have to do to play is put your ship in one of the tracks and let it go. You can adjust the knob on the board to control the speed (amount of vibration), but you don’t have to fiddle with anything else to play! Just flip the switch and you’re off to search for treasure!

Players choose from one of 4 - '1.5" long' ships made of tin and plastic, which are piloted by either Mickey, Donald, Goofy or Pluto. Each character has a differently colored background on their game piece. There are four Ports to choose from as a starting point for each player.

The goal is to sail for the Treasure Chests at the top, worth from $200 to $500! Many sailors will be side tracked along the way into one of the many Coves where lesser treasure of $100 can still be found. But watch out! Captain Hook is on the prowl as his ship starts out from Pirate’s Cove from the top of the board and if you are intercepted by his ship, you’re sunk!

Some of the lesser treasure coves along the routes include names like Smugger's Cove, Doubloon Cove, Neverland Cove, Skeleton Cove, Shark Cove and several others. The Treasure Chests at the top include Captain Kidd's Treasure, Captain Morgan's Treasure, Captain Hook's Treasure and Long John Silver's Treasure.

DESCRIPTION OF HOW TO PLAY PROVIDED BY Jason Monroe
(belial1134) after a short visit to the Unidentified Games Area

126934.name: The Savage World of My Little Pony (Provisional Editions)
126934.description:
From Introduction:

This module for the Savage Worlds system has been specifically written so that it stays as honest and true to the show that inspired it, My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic. As such, several key rules presented below have been added to those normally found in the Savage Worlds Explorer’s Edition to facilitate this.

The Tenet Against Violence

Many roleplaying games prominently feature violence as one of the most important tools, if not the most important, at the disposal of the player characters. While this is a perfectly valid path (and makes for some exciting action and adventure) to take in a game, The Savage World of My Little Pony is meant to stay true to the show that created it. As such, the rules emphasize creative problem solving, storytelling, roleplaying, and teamwork over physical violence. In the show My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic, the characters defeat terrifying monsters and villains all without the use of violence, even in the face of similar danger. Every instance of violence in response is quickly shown to be futile, and the characters eventually triumph through their own skills, force of will, and teamwork. It is this spirit that The Savage World of My Little Pony seeks to capture, and in order to do this, an important rule has been added to the ones presented in the Savage Worlds Explorer’s Edition, called the Tenet Against Violence:
In any game session in which one or more of the players resorted to violence, whether it is physical violence or other actions intended to cause deliberate physical or mental harm to themselves or others, all players receive no experience points for that session. This is ultimately up to the Game Master’s discretion, but it is intended to punish players who violate the spirit of the show and of the game.

In place of the normal combat system featured in Savage Worlds, this module presents an alternate re-flavoring of the mechanics of combat in order to stay true to the show. These alternate rules allow for the same fast-paced action present in Savage Worlds.

126936.name: The Savage World of My Little Pony (3rd Edition)
126936.description:
From Introduction:

The Savage World of My Little Pony uses several Setting Rules found in the Savage Worlds Deluxe Edition, some of which are different from what is found in the core rules. Each Setting Rule is listed in full below; some of these are optional but strongly recommended for most games. Optional Setting Rules are noted as such in their individual entries.

A Contest of Wills
The Savage World of My Little Pony adds a new system for combat using ‘Clash of Wills’ attacks that can inflict ‘daunts’ on your opponents in a similar fashion to attacks and wounds. These are explained in more detail in their own section on Combat as part of the Game Rules chapter.

Critical Failures
Optional; When a character rolls a ‘1’ on both dice (snake eyes) on a Trait roll, they cannot spend a Benny to re-roll it and are stuck with the critical failure.

Heroes Never Die
Optional; With this rule in play, characters who would normally die are simply knocked out for a dramatically appropriate time instead. Only if the situation is particularly heroic, or if it serves as a major story point can characters actually die. For example, a character who tumbles off of a cliff in the midst of an epic battle with the adventure’s villain may catch onto a ledge and pull themselves to safety before blacking out. They are still ‘out’ for that particular scene as if they had died, but they can eventually climb to safety. Conversely, villains are similarly hard to get rid of permanently and will find ways to escape or come back even after being defeated.

No Power Points
Instead of using Power Points, unicorns simply choose the spell they want to cast and make a Spellcraft roll. The penalty to the roll is specific to the spell itself.
Once cast, check the results below:

Success: The spell activates as usual.
Raise: A raise on the roll grants additional bonuses to the spell stated in its description.
Failure: The spell does not activate.




Backlash- There is no backlash effect if a unicorn rolls a ‘1’ on their Spellcraft die.
Maintaining Powers- Unicorns can maintain spells as long as desired up to the limit of their duration, but each spell maintained inflicts a –1 penalty to cast any new spells. You may choose to cancel any number of maintained spells as a free action.
Interrupting Powers- If a unicorn with an activated spell is Shaken or suffers a wound, daunt, or fatigue level, they must make a Smarts roll to maintain all their spells. If the roll is failed, all spells are instantly dropped. Maintained spells shut down automatically if the caster sleeps or is rendered unconscious.
Spell Preparation- A unicorn may prepare a spell by concentrating for a round (no movement or other actions besides free actions and avoid interruption, as described above). If successful, they ignore 2 points of penalties on all spells cast with their next action. If they do not enact any spells on their next action, the preparation is lost.
Cantrips- Cantrips do not normally require a Spellcraft roll to cast successfully (some can have Cast Options if you choose to roll as part of using the cantrip). However, any cantrips that you maintain inflict penalties as if they were maintained spells.

The Tenet Against Violence

Many roleplaying games prominently feature violence as one of the most important tools, if not the most important, at the disposal of the player characters. While this is a perfectly valid path (and makes for some exciting action and adventure) to take in a game, The Savage World of My Little Pony is meant to stay true to the show that created it. As such, the rules emphasize creative problem solving, storytelling, roleplaying, and teamwork over physical violence. In the show My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic, the characters defeat terrifying monsters and villains all without the use of violence, even in the face of similar danger. Every instance of violence in response is quickly shown to be futile, and the characters eventually triumph through their own skills, force of will, and teamwork. It is this spirit that The Savage World of My Little Pony seeks to capture, and in order to do this, an important rule has been added to the ones presented in the Savage Worlds Explorer’s Edition, called the Tenet Against Violence:
In any game session in which one or more of the players resorted to violence, whether it is physical violence or other actions intended to cause deliberate physical or mental harm to themselves or others, all players receive no experience points for that session. This is ultimately up to the Game Master’s discretion, but it is intended to punish players who violate the spirit of the show and of the game.

In place of the normal combat system featured in Savage Worlds, this module presents an alternate re-flavoring of the mechanics of combat in order to stay true to the show. These alternate rules allow for the same fast-paced action present in Savage Worlds.

126937.name: Wild Hunt (Issue 37 - Feb 1979)
126937.description:
User Summary of Contents:

Fenris Speaks #32 by Glenn Blacow

My Name is Legion #37 by Mark Swanson

Gorree Armies




Al Araaf #13 by R Mark Chilenskas

The Name of the Game is Dungeons & Dragons #17 by Bill Seligman

Answer to A Horatio Alger Mystery from issue #35




The Runelord Writes #3 by John T Sapienza Jr

Karma by Peggy Gemignani

'zine name change
Introducing her new world Mirrorlight




Letters from the Outer Realm #1 by Chuck Huber

126939.name: Dead Space 3
126939.description:
Dead Space 3 is a survival horror video game, developed by Visceral Games. It is the sequel to Dead Space 2 and, as announced at E3 2012 on June 4, 2012, is the third main entry of the Dead Space series.

Having crash-landed on a frozen planet known as Tau Volantis, Isaac Clarke hopes that this hostile new environment contains the key to ending the Necromorph scourge.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dead Space 3," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

126941.description:
Seven honorable and brave samurai, aided by a handful of frightened villagers, are the only defenders of the village. Will you help these villagers to fend off bandits, or will you command the thieves to steal all the rice you can and punish the insolent peasants?

Seven Swords is a game for two players in which one player controls seven samurai and the villagers to try to repel the attack of the evil villains while the other player controls the bandits who try to steal all the rice they can and destroy the village. The game lasts 18 turns, after which the player with the most victory points (VPs) wins. The samurai player begins the game with the VPs in the villagers' houses and rice stores, and the bandit player must attack peasant houses and steal rice to acquire these VPs. The bandit player can also earn extra points if he eliminates the samurai in combat.

Each turns consists of two phases. The bandit, who plays first, has seven cards in hand that symbolize the seven sectors of the village. He discards a card to give himself a number of actions that turn, and he might receive additional actions from the samurai player. With these actions, the bandit can play different bandit troops – including infantry, archers and cavalry – with which he can then move around the village and attack the samurai, villagers and rice storage. The samurai player then chooses between five chips – combat, movement, leadership and two special action chips – to see how many actions that he has that turn. A samurai can perform three types of actions – attack, move, and use the villagers to attack bandits – but only one time for each samurai until one of the special chips has removed the counters of such action. The more actions that the samurai player performs, the more actions the bandit has.

After a certain number of turns, the bandit player discards one of his action cards, then eliminates any samurai who is in the field of the discarded card. Other details in the game include bows that help players attack from a distance and fences that keep the bandits from just walking into the village. In addition to having a double-sided game board with different village layouts, the samurai player establishes the placement of villagers, fences, nows and rice storage at the start of each game, allowing for wide variability in gameplay.
126941.name: Seven Swords

126942.description:
Bellor’s Retribution Includes: - 32 Cards

Mountain Vargath Units
1 Bellor - Champion
1 Luka - Champion
1 Varn - Champion
5 Wardens - Common
5 Storm Mages - Common

Swamp Orc Units
1 Murk - Champion
1 Glurp - Champion
1 Splack - Champion
5 Swamp Beasts - Common
5 Conjurers - Common

Mercenary Units
1 Kogar - Champion
5 Rogues - Common
126942.name: Summoner Wars: Bellor's Retribution Reinforcement Pack

126943.description:
Saella's Precision Includes: - 31 Cards

Filth Units
1 Her - Champion
1 Vomitus - Champion
1 Absorption Mutant
1 Incanter Mutant
1 Spellsucker Mutant
1 Stoneflesh Mutant
1 Void Mutant
5 Anointed - Common

Mercenary Units
1 Saella - Champion
1 Duggle - Champion
1 Rath - Champion
1 Urick - Champion
5 Sword Grounders - Common
5 Bow Grounders - Common
5 Time Mages - Common
126943.name: Summoner Wars: Saella's Precision Reinforcement Pack

126944.description:
Get Bit! is a 2 to 6 player game. These expansions allow another player to jump in the water and try their hand against the hungry shark.

The Pink Robot Expansion includes the pink figure, Spider Woman stickers, and all the cards needed to play the game with this extra color.

The Orange Robot Expansion includes the orange figure, Bruce stickers, and all the cards needed to play the game with this extra color.

The Green Zombie Expansion includes the green figure, zombie stickers, and all the cards needed to play the game with this extra color.

The Black Panda Expansion includes the black figure, panda stickers, and all the cards needed to play the game with this extra color.

The second editions of some of the expansions include the dolphin card, but the Dolphin Die expansion can be used without the extra card - just use the highest card as the dolphin card (this card would be replaced with the dolphin card if it was used).
126944.name: Get Bit! Additional Player Expansion

126946.name: Sentinel (Commodore 64 game)
126946.description:
User Summary

Sentinel is the sequel to "Dimension X", which was released on the Atari 8-bit series of computers.

You are in command of a fighter-ship and your role is to sweep 50 sectors clear of enemy fighters.

Initially, and between waves, you are presented with a 10x5 grid of sectors. The sectors give an indication of enemy strength by means of differing numbers of dots in each sector.

On warping into a sector, you control a set of crosshairs which indicates the fall of shot of your two laser cannons. Your aim is to destroy all the enemy targets in the sector. This is aided through the use of a radar which allows you to locate off-screen targets.

In-game text

Gorganitor squadrons detected in all sectors of you Star Cluster. Unable to send additional cruisers but have warped four base stations to your Defense Grid. Good Luck...

126947.name: Archery Range
126947.description:
From the Introduction:

Part of an even larger compound is this quite sizeable training hall for archers with its attached archery range. Very little of the actual training hall is built from stone. Most of it has been constructed from wood. Its back wall consists entirely of sliding doors opening towards the practice range. The archery range in turn is essentially a grassy square, surrounded by a low retaining wall to keep people from wandering into the line of fire. At the far end of the yard a number of straw targets on wooden frames are arranged under a simple roof to protect them from the weather. A few more of these targets stand in the training hall itself.

126948.name: Of Pride & Policy
126948.description:
The people call out for Justice. We’ll give them Justice. They call out for Liberty and we’ll give them that too. We’ll give them everything that they call out for, exactly as we’ve designed. And in our magnanimity we will turn the ear of the King in our favor. That is when things really start to change. For once you’ve had the King’s ear, his eyes are sure to move too. Sooner or later, you may find that you’ve gotten hold of his whole head.

Our time is coming and if we have to swallow our pride and dance a dance for King and people while biding our time, then so be it. We have a vision for this land, and by the power invested in us, we will make it so.


Of Pride & Policy is a game of political maneuvering for 3-5 players. There are 4 sets of opposing political issues in the game each one with a color and symbol:

Expansionism Vs. Isolationism
Conservatism Vs. Liberalism
Industry Vs. Agriculture
Liberty Vs. Justice

The kingdom is divided into 5 regions: Galicia, Castilla, Madrid, Portugal and Andalucia. Each region is divided into 5 or 7 territories. Each territory will have particular concern in one of the eight political issues.

Each player represents a Noble family. At the start of the game players will have no particular stance on any of the issues; however, this will soon change. Players will influence both territories and legislation in order to advance in the Court of the King. All the while, the political state of the kingdom will change.

126949.description:
After Omnitron's defeat at the hands of the Freedom Five, its various pieces were collected in the Eaken-Rubendall lab for study by Dr. Meredith Stinson. She was not the only one interested in studying the automaton which brought about its own sentience, however. A mysterious cosmic entity had observed as a simple factory transformed itself into a being of great intellect and order, and this entity was disappointed to see it brought to so swift an end.
Dr. Stinson's lab was rocked by cosmic rays as the entity sought to give self-made self-awareness a second chance. The cosmic force gathered the many technological advancements of the lab together, making them available to the processing core that was once Omnitron, and bound them all together with wires and connections of pure energy.

OMNITRON was reborn. Planet Earth was in grave danger. And a cosmic force watched from a vast distance away, almost disinterested in the outcome of its own experiment.

Cosmic Omnitron is a promo card that was given as part of the Kickstarter project for Sentinels of the Multiverse 2nd Edition & Infernal Relics expansion. The oversized version is available as part of the Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards.
126949.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Cosmic Omnitron Villain Promo Card

boardgameaccessory.148677: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards

126950.description:
After the destruction of his TerraLunar Impulsion Beam at the hands of his nemesis Legacy, Baron Blade narrowly made his escape from the Freedom Five. Now, he has returned, but without the devices and minions he usually employs to distract the heroes. This time, the Baron has hidden bombs throughout the city of Megalopolis and is threatening to blow the entire city sky high if the heroes do not disarm the bombs in time. However, he has sent video footage of his bombs to the Freedom Five headquarters, giving them the clues they need to find and dispose of the explosives. What maniacal plan does this madman have up his sleeves, and when he reveals them, will the heroes be able to save the city, or will they be caught in Baron Blade's twisted trap?

Vengeful Baron Blade is a promo card that was given as part of the Kickstarter project for Sentinels of the Multiverse 2nd Edition & Infernal Relics expansion. The oversized version is available as part of the Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards.
126950.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Mad Bomber Blade Villain Promo Card

boardgameaccessory.148677: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards

126951.description:
Ansel G. Moreau, world-famous French action movie star, has a few dark secrets. His hobby of big game hunting has spiraled out of control – his constant need for bigger and more threatening prey has him hunting the very heroes that protect the earth! To this end, he employed a shady genetics corporation to give him superpowers, but the process went terribly wrong, scarring his million-dollar face and ending his acting career.

However, he did gain some new, energy-manipulation abilities from the process, which he plans to put to good use. Taking the name Ambuscade, he employs his new powers and a vast arsenal to hunt the heroes he considers to be the most dangerous and powerful. At the top of his list? Haka, the ageless Maori warrior. No one else could provide a sufficient challenge to one as skilled as Ambuscade, the world's most efficient and calculating hunter...

Sentinels of the Multiverse: Ambuscade Villain Character is a new villain character, with his own unique villain deck of 25 cards, a rules card, and a character card.
126951.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Ambuscade Villain Character

boardgameaccessory.148677: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards

126952.name: Penny Arcade's On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness 3
126952.description:
User Summary

Penny Arcade's On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness 3 is the long-delayed third instalment of the formerly episodic Penny Arcade Adventures series. Having undergone a change in developers, it also shifts style to a classic 16-bit JRPG-like aesthetic.

126953.description:
In Western in my Pocket, players take on the role of a heroic Sheriff in the old west. Take out the hideout of the Notorious Jones Gang before they rob the noon train!

Western in my Pocket started as a spinoff to Zombie in my Pocket.

Western in my Pocket is a Solitaire tile-laying adventure game set in the Old West. Players lay tiles beginning at the Sheriff's Office, and must find dynamite at the Survey Camp and get to the mine and blow it up before noon. While you're doing this, there are bandits around that will try and stop you. Western in my Pocket features a modular board, so no 2 games are ever the same.

There are also scenarios planned to expand upon the base game, and offer the player more fun in the Old West.
126953.name: Western in my Pocket

126954.description: Flash Point: Fire Rescue - 2nd Story, an expansion pack for Flash Point: Fire Rescue, contains two double-sided mounted game boards and a counter sheet that contains ladders, windows, an explosion marker, and more. Each game board represents one floor of a building, and the player firefighters will need to cover more area in this expansion to keep things under control. Ladders and stairs provide access to the upper building level, and windows let firefighters enter and leave the building without causing structural damage.
126954.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – 2nd Story

126955.name: Pawn Mob
126955.description:
This is a two player abstract strategy game played on a chessboard (simulates a brawl between two mobs in an enclosed area). This is played with eight pawns per side. Pawns start from the opposite extreme ranks. White moves first. Movements are as per pawn movement in chess. But opponent's pawns are not captured when they come in diagonally to each other. Instead they are pushed one square backward orthogonally. If there is no space to move orthogonally (square occupied by another pawn or there is no space in the board) then the attacked pawn is captured. One point is awarded per captured pawn and for each pawn which reach the opposite ranks. Game ends when no more pawns can be moved for either side. Player with most points wins.

Game rules will be uploaded soon.

126956.name: Poly Pulp
126956.description:
From the front cover:

A collection of Pulp Adventure Scenarios designed for and run at PolyCon XXX

User note:

Includes one scenario run at PolyCon XXIX that is a prequel to one of the scenarios from XXX. Seven scenarios total

126958.name: Eldritch Skies
126958.description:
Publisher Blurb:

It is 2030. The Gilman-Hawking drive has given us access to the stars. But we are not alone.

They're out there: aliens, gods and monsters. They're also down here. The Miskatonic Antarctic Expedition found the elder ones' city in 1931. The mi-go crashed in Roswell in 1947.

In 1958, as quietly as possible, not knowing what we were doing, we bent occult powers to our hands and took the step to Mars. The third time, the men who made that step could not step back. We fled back into our cave for a while.

But rocketry, and the Soviets, brought us back out soon enough. Competition took us to the moon. Uneasy teamwork saved the astronauts who would have died there among cyclopean, immemorial ruins.

In 1994, human scientists cracked alien technology and overcame the lightspeed barrier. They brought us the stars. They also brought us the madness that lies between them, the mind-twisting undarkness of hyperspace.

The future is here. Machine-made telepathy, augmentations, and unprecedented levels of automation have changed the face of Earth. But the science of sorcery, and our primitive understandings of what lies outside, have changed more than our minuscule planet. They've begun to let humanity out.

We walk amongst giants. Tread carefully.

This book is a complete role-playing game of Lovecraftian science fiction that uses the Cinematic Unisystem. It contains all rules needed to play, and requires no additional material beyond your imagination and a few dice.

126959.name: Cities of Gold
126959.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gold will buy your freedom. Forget the cheap credos of false gods and foolish brawlers; they cling to ideals while their children starve. Whatever you desire, we can make real.

Gold will buy your strength. Forget the petty threats of pauper magicians and idiot militia; their lifeblood flows through our coffers, and we sell the spears they shake. Whoever you detest, we can crush.

Gold will buy your service. Forget the broken fallacies of selfless honour and noble intent; one man built this empire, and rules it with a fist of gilded iron. Whatever he decrees, we will do.

The Cities of Gold tower over the fallen nations of the past… and soon will tower over the fallen Corporations of the present. For in the end, we will buy them all.

Welcome, Agent, to Eurasian Incorporated.

Features

Hoards of background information on the most ruthless, greedy and inhuman corporation ever to grace the Earth
New sects and perhaps the most obscene Rank bonuses in the corporate world
Stacks of new items including luxury goods, banned and restricted weapons and Anti-Plasma Core Armour
More information on running and expanding your own businesses
More cybernetics and how corporate culture views augmentation
Teleportation technology and new luxury vehicles
Medical procedures and the healthcare system
E.I.'s upper echelons including staff, management and methodology
New NPCs and locations

126960.name: Gate 22
126960.description:
From publisher blurb:

Before the Five and their conquest of the earth, millions died in the name of peace and progress. The Corporations exterminated countless victims in their centuries of war, burning their names from the history books. But Agents are hard to kill... and the dark corners of the world conceal many secrets.

Beyond the Five and their plodding research programs, a sickening subculture of twisted science breeds and thrives. The Corporations blunder into the endless void of space and the icy murk of the oceans, heedless of anything that will not sate their rapacious greed. But others obsessively seek to understand the unknown... and hide their forbidden studies from prying eyes.

Beneath the Five and their little empires, an old and lightless world spans endless miles of labyrinthine gloom. The Corporations no longer go down here, into the freezing black, where too many have already been lost. But this place is not deserted... and whatever happens, your screams will never reach the world above.

The UIG has sent you into ancient darkness, Agent... and it does not care if you come back.

Behind Gate 22 is the horror of the truth.

A wealth of variety including stealth, combat, negotiation, diplomacy, and investigation.
A large equipment section which can be used even when the mission is finished.
Varied NPCs, all of which can be used in regular Corporation games.
More details about cities and locations around the world.
And of course, more things we can't reveal for fear of spoiling the story.




Gate 22 is a huge mission for a cross-corporation division spanning some 120 pages. It's designed not to be a one use item and once you've completed the mission there will still be a wealth of new equipment, NPCs, locations and maps you can use in your normal Corporation game.

126961.name: Corporation Services & Amenities Index
126961.description:
From publisher blurb:

A complete list of services and amenities from all Corporation books printed until Jan 2011.

126962.name: Corporation Trainings List
126962.description:
From publisher blurb:

A list of all Trainings in the Corporation RPG to 14th of January 2011.

126963.name: Corporation Cybernetics List
126963.description:
From publisher blurb:

A complete list of all cybernetic upgrades compiled from all books up to and including The Mind Unbound.

126964.name: Corporation UIG Penalties List
126964.description:
From publisher blurb:

A complete list of UIG Rank Point based penalties compiled from all books up to and including The Mind Unbound. There are also entries related to rank point loss such as the effects of Lawyers.

126965.name: Gobble Gobble
126965.description:
From publisher blurb:

The CEO has got his hands on a grainy piece of footage captured in the mountains of northern Russia. It looks like....a turkey...but no ordinary turkey....this beast is massive, it could wipe out a division with its mighty peck.

Unfortunate then, that you have been the ones trusted to bring it back....ALIVE!

Gobble Gobble is a tongue in cheek Christmas Special for the Corporation RPG. Suitable for any level characters and any Corporation.

126966.description:
Zmaster adds a fifth player to the Zpocalypse main game as the game master. This new player controls the zombies as they converge upon the survivors, who are trying to protect their bunker. Via zombie upgrades, new mutated zombie miniatures and the Deck of Doom, the zombie master adds new mechanics which spice up an already epic zombie survival game. Choose which scenario you prefer for the style of zombies to combat each game. Zmaster provides rules and mechanics for altering the physics of the game to make it harder or easier, depending on your preferences and style of play. It turns Zpocalypse into the ultimate sandbox for testing out survival strategies and testing out how one would cope with a zombie threat.


Game Master mechanics
x30 Mutated zombie miniatures
Zmaster Rage wheel (Tallies which cards can be played)
Mutations deck (Stats for new zombies)
Upgrades deck (Makes zombies progressively harder, also used for various scenarios)
Doom deck (Actions the Zmaster can use on other players)
New Scenarios Cards
New Daily Goal Cards
Requires the Zpocalypse main game to play
126966.name: Zpocalypse: Zmaster

126967.name: Pippi Langstrumpf Puzzlejagd
126967.description:
Childrens game where the players race to complete a jigsaw first.

Each player chooses a different colour and is given the eight pieces that will make up a picture of Pippi Langstrumpf. In your turn, you roll the special die. The die has freckles instead of numbers except for the face that shows the monkey Herr Nilsson. If the monkey is rolled, that player can start to assemble his jigsaw and he may continue to try until another player rolls the monkey and cries "Stop!". Then that player can start his jigsaw. It continues in this way until someone has completed the puzzle and that person is the winner.

126968.name: McPixel
126968.description:
McPixel is a new take on point'n'click adventure games. It's like you took old Lucas Arts adventure games, put them into blender and add few shovels of gunpowder and rocket fuel.

There are 100 levels and you only have 20 seconds to solve each of them. You fail - stuff blows up and you continue to the next level, for as long as you beat the entire batch. Batches have 6 levels that you play round and round, since playing 100 levels straight would be too much for a human brain to take.

Levels in McPixel are anything you can imagine. A deserted island, an alien spaceship, death star, school, train, plane, stadium, sewers, lighthouse. Just anything! And it all blows up in the end. Well, unless you can do something about it!

And don't think that the solutions will be obvious! it's a point'n'click adventure game after all, so the most obvious choices are bound to fail. and the most annoying adventure game feature has been gotten rid of. I mean, dialogues, monologues and text et all. there is no time for small talks if you only have 20 seconds! So instead of starting a useless banter, McPixel just kicks balls.

Source: The Game Website.

126970.name: Hotel Giant 2
126970.description:
Following its tremendous success, Hotel Giant is coming back better than ever. In Hotel Giant 2 you will create the hotels of your dreams and become the manager of prestigious palaces. Create your own success story and never forget that the customer is always right!

Source: The Publisher Website.

126971.name: Blitz Bolide
126971.description:
BLITZ BOLIDE is a racing car game based on Formula 1 race.
THE PURPOSE OF BLITZ BOLIDE IS TO PLAY WITH 1/64 MINIATURE AND HAVE GREAT FUN IN DOING THAT. At this scale, a car has 7,5 cm or 3 inches length.
Blitz Bolide is played on tracks which are made of spaces. The average length of a lap is between 40 spaces (fast tracks) and 60 spaces (long tracks).

HOW TO PLAY : a car has four levels of gear : low, intermediate, high, and extreme.
Each turn, his driver can increase or decrease this gear by 1 level.
After that, he rolls 2 dice : according to the results of the dice, and according to the gear, the car is moved by a certain number of spaces.
Move bonuses (in terms of spaces) are given by tyres, fuel gauge, suspension, etc...
Once moved, a car can engage another car in order to gain its position.

There are two important difficulties in the game :
a) How to manage the Damage Points (DP) ?
Each car begins the race with 8 DPs. DPs are lost during brutal brakings, during engagement, when the car is going out of track, at extreme gear, etc...
A car is eliminated if it goes under 0 DP.
The higher the speed, the faster you lose DPs. But you cannot win if your speed is too low...Here Pit Stop strategy is very important for purpose of managing DPs.
b) How to take the corners ?
Each corner has an optimal gear. If its gear exceeds the optimal gear while taking a corner, a car can goes out of track (losing speed and possibly DPs).
However, a driver has 3 choices when his car is about to take a bend : short, medium, or long trajectory. With a short trajectory, you go faster, but it's risky. With a long trajectory, you take the corner more easily, but you become an easy target if engaged by opponents...
Here, tyre strategy, set-up (aero grip, suspension, etc..), are very important things for purpose of taking a corner.

Basic rules cover : hard or soft tyres, fuel gauge, pit stop, optimal gear in bend, fast bend, etc...
Advanced rules cover :advanced set-up (pit stop efficiency, bolide's toughness, etc...) defective gearbox, rain tyres, meteo.
Expert rules cover : aero grip, suspension, oversteering, understeering, engine power, qualification lap, Events card.

For the moment, there are 8 tracks : Monaco, Canada, Belgium, Japan, Italy, Catalunya, Singapore, China.

126972.description:
Number 12 -- the last -- in a year-long series of monthly releases of expansion maps for the China/Web of Power family of games. Another map set in China, but with very different geography.

Released officially June 2012 at michaelschacht.net.

Map download available at michaelschacht.net/p/chinaSpecialmap.jpg.
126972.name: China: Priest and Emperor

126973.name: International Matchplay Golf
126973.description:
Statistical golf replay game. Players are rated in various skills based on their performances in competitions like the Ryder Cup. Dice are used to give results based on the skill in question at that time. It would be quite easy to use the system to rate players up to date.

Bernhard Langer on the cover.

126974.name: Dead Fire
126974.description:
From Introduction:

Dead Fire is a challenging adventure for characters levels 1-3 with a total average party level of no more than 12 and serves as an excellent introduction to the 3rd edition rules. The party should consist of 4-6 characters and it would be a good idea, but not absolutely necessary to include a wizard and a ranger in the group. Most of the adventure takes place in the wilderness surrounding the small village of Foresthall, where an unnatural forest fire grows larger by the minute. The blaze threatens the survival of both Foresthall and Valmirindi, a nearby elven community.

126975.name: White Robes, Black Hearts: Enigma of the Arcanexus
126975.description:
From Introduction:

White Robes, Black Hearts: Enigma of the Arcanexus is a challenging campaign adventure for characters levels 3-5, and serves as a logical continuation from the previously released free module Dead Fire. It is recommended that the PCs consists of 4-6 characters (about party level 5), and it is almost vital to the adventure for a party to include a wizard or sorcerer, and a rogue. Certain areas of this adventure are extremely dangerous, and so you should decide whether you wish to keep extra NPCs on file for the players to adopt, or whether you want to be liberal in your interpretation of the rules for lingering at death’s door and the rules regarding the limitations of resurrection. While this adventure is designed to be difficult, it is not designed to kill parties.
